author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Gold Stays Flat on Easing Trade Tensions, Slightly Weaker Dollar
text:
Gold prices extended their recent bout of weakness Monday morning before closing flat on the day, hurt by easing trade tensions between the U.S. and China but eventually benefiting from a slightly weaker dollar.
Front-month gold for May delivery closed unchanged at $1,290.20 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have fallen into negative territory for 2018 lately with geopolitical risks fading and the dollar rising to its highest level of the year.
...
